botanical_details.genus: Rosa can be deciduous or semi-evergreen shrubs or scrambling climbers, with usually thorny stems bearing compound pinnate leaves and solitary or clustered flowers. Flowers may be followed by showy red or purple fruits in some varieties.
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Rambler roses are vigorous shrubs with long, arching, thorny or smooth stems carrying glossy foliage and large sprays of small, single or double, often fragrant flowers in early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun with moderately fertile, humus-rich, moist but well-drained soil. For best flowering apply a balanced fertiliser and mulch in late winter or early spring and a balanced fertiliser again in early summer. Tolerant of poor soil, shade and a north aspect. Suitable for climbing into trees
how_to_grow.propagation: Root hardwood cuttings in summer; bud in summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Rose pruning: rambling roses see pruning roses
how_to_grow.pests: Susceptible to rose aphid, scale insects, caterpillars, rose leaf-rolling sawfly larvae, rose leafhopper, rose root aphid, and leaf-cutting bees; rabbits and deer may cause damage
how_to_grow.diseases: Rose black spot, rose rust, rose powdery mildew, rose replant disease, rose blindness, rose dieback and canker, rose balling and grey mould, honey fungus, a virus and downy mildew are all possible problems
